title: Senior housing and property management
overviewOfRole: Managing property-related services, leading a team and taking responsibility for the cost effectiveness and efficiency of their business area.

knowledges.detail: Principles, practices and legislation and the role of regulatory bodies relating to current landlord and tenant law and housing consumer and regulator standards, including the Social Housing Regulation Act, Building Safety Act, the Decent Homes Standard, the Housing Ombudsman, and risk factors.
Equity, diversity, and inclusion in the workplace, mental health and wellbeing regulation, The Equality Act and its requirements on organisations.
Legislation and regulatory requirements applying to governance, contracts, procurement, reporting, insurance, data protection and conflicts of interest.
Legal processes to manage contractual arrangements for different tenures.
Principles and strategies for resource, budget and change management and reporting, including risk management, funding sources and methods for managing rents and arrears.
Organisational   values, roles   and   responsibilities and how they contribute to business objectives, priorities, planning and customer engagement.

The diverse range and requirements of customers, clients and stakeholders, including vulnerable individuals and groups and those with complex needs, safeguarding and the behavioural and ethical considerations needed to engage with them.
National housing policy and the strategic value of the historical, social and physical context of the estates and neighbourhoods.
Oral and written communication approaches and strategies in a range of contexts, including conflict resolution, and engaging with clients, customers, stakeholders and/or partner agencies.
Principles and leadership strategies for people management, collaborative working, influencing and negotiating, including performance management principles and techniques.
Principles and practices to deliver allocations, lettings, financial and social inclusion services, tenancy sustainment and social value.
Processes and strategies for managing anti-social behaviour.
Processes and approaches to ensuring repairs, maintenance, Health and Safety and housing support service in line with current legislation.
Effective data and information management methods, including strategies for collecting, sharing and analysing data and using digital tools.
Principles of sustainability for housing and property management, including climate change and environmental protection.
Policies and procedures for recording and reporting complaints.

behaviours.detail: Responsibility. Takes timely, flexible action to address complex issues, embraces change and is committed to their continual development. Dedicated to ensuring the right outcomes for customers and advocates for the wider housing sector and housing profession.
Resilience. Works independently and competently without requiring close supervision.
Integrity. Takes accountability for their actions, gives due attention to environmental and social factors and professionally manages legal and ethical issues.

Leadership. Models confidence and decisiveness when solving problems and demonstrates flexibility, exercising professional judgement and acting as a role model in the face of challenges to meet objectives and support customers.

Respect. Is transparent and empathetic with clients and customers, demonstrating honesty with those they work with and exercising and discretion and confidentiality when appropriate. Listens to and involves tenants in decision-making and supports an equitable, diverse and inclusive working culture.
Collaboration. Builds strong connections with customers and encourages an environment where colleagues can share their opinions and contribute to the team.
Professional practice. Reflects on own professional practice and manages continuing professional development.

skills.detail: Deliver housing and property management services to meet the needs of customers, clients and stakeholders.
Communicate and collaborate effectively with colleagues, clients, customers, stakeholders and/or partner agencies using communication and negotiation strategies.
Manage and mentor individuals or teams, and support training, development and wellbeing needs.
Assist the management of legal processes, for example first-tier tribunals, upper tribunals/ASPs and safeguarding.
Ensure services meet the needs of vulnerable individuals and groups, including those with complex needs.
Undertake risk analysis and ensure compliance in line with regulation and procedure.
Analyse data and share information using the appropriate methods and applications.
Manage budgets and report on financial performance to ensure value for money.
Apply performance management principles and techniques.
Apply project management techniques and tools to deliver service improvements.
Record and report complaints in line with policies and procedures.
Apply operational and strategic thinking to make decisions, solve problems, prioritise and meet individual, team and business objectives.
Apply sustainability principles when using resources for example, efficient use of resources, waste minimisation.
Apply equity, diversity, and inclusion procedures.

involvedEmployers: Bromford Housing Association, Chartered Institute of Housing, Dexters, Housing 21, Leeds City Council, LiveWest, Ministry for Housing, Communities and Local Government, Notting Hill Genesis, Orbit, SJW Consultancy, Southern Housing Group, The Property Institute
englishAndMathsQualifications: <p>English and maths qualifications must be completed in line with the <a rel="noopener" href="https://www.gov.uk/guidance/apprenticeship-funding-rules" target="_blank">apprenticeship funding rules</a>.</p>
reviewDetails: this apprenticeship will be reviewed in accordance with our change request policy.
clusterDescription: Manage and deliver services to customers along with problem resolution and service improvement
banners: This revised version of the standard has been agreed and is available for information only at present. A revised assessment plan is currently being developed and will be published in due course. In the meantime the current version remains approved for delivery

professionalRecognition.partialFreeText: the apprentice will need to produce their apprenticeship certificate.

The apprentice will need to have 5 years’ experience of working in the sector at the time of application. They will need to produce their apprenticeship certificate, complete a declaration form, and meet the professional and academic requirements of Propertymark.

The apprentice will need to produce their apprenticeship certificate and evidence that their training programme has matched the L4 syllabus approved by TPI. If the training programme does not meet TPI requirements the apprentice will be expected to sign up for an online training course.

duties.dutyDetail: Manage and undertake risk assessment and compliance responsibilities in line with legislation.
Manage and apply legal contractual processes for different tenures.
Undertake customer service and stakeholder engagement to meet the needs of clients, customers, stakeholders and/or partner agencies.
Lead, motivate, manage and develop individuals and teams to ensure excellent services are delivered.
Comply with complaint processes and procedures in line with relevant regulation.
Manage budgets and report on financial performance to ensure value for money.
Ensure organisational and individual compliance with environmental, social and governance policies and processes.
Undertake and manage the necessary processes to ensure the maintenance, repair and inspections of various properties.
Manage contracts and comply with insurance responsibilities.
